page.title: 05HOUSING & BUILDINGS
page.content:
Although Melton Mowbray is very old, very few of its buildings are more than 80 or 90 years old. The oldest buildings are in or near the town centre.e.g.the Parish Church, the almshouses, the Anne of Cleves House and the Swan Porch which recently burnt down.
Along the sides of the main roads leading into Melton Mowbray, large houses were built between 1886-1904. Since the war there has been much redevelopment and new housing estates have filled in the areas between the main roads.
Unfortunately many old buildings in the town centre have been demolished to make way for newer shops while others have merely changed their use.
